noun.description: A songbird with glossy black plumage and typically a long forked tail and a crest, found in Africa, southern Asia, and Australia.

examples: I gave that drongo fifty dollars and he only gave me change for ten!

origin: Mid 19th century: from Malagasy. drongo (sense 2) is said to be from the name of an Australian racehorse of the 1920s which consistently finished last or near last.
